S4.T1.caption: Table 1: Results comparison with existing methods on OK-VQA dataset marino2019ok , the evaluation metric (i.e., accuracy) is in %.
S4.T1.table:
Method Knowledge Resources Accuracy (%)
Q only marino2019ok - 14.9
MLP marino2019ok - 20.7
BAN marino2019ok - 25.1
BAN+AN marino2019ok Wikipedia 25.6
MUTAN marino2019ok - 26.4
BAN+KG-AUG li2020boosting Wikipedia+ConceptNet 26.7
MUTAN+AN marino2019ok Wikipedia 27.8
ConceptBERT garderes2020conceptbert ConceptNet 33.7
KRISP marino2021krisp Wikipedia + ConceptNet 38.4
Visual Retriever-Reader luo2021weakly Google Search 39.2
MAVEx wu2021multi Wikipedia+ConceptNet+Google Images 39.4
PICa-Base yang2021empirical Frozen GPT-3 (175B) 43.3
PICa-Full yang2021empirical Frozen GPT-3 (175B) 48.0
KAT (Single) gui2021kat Wikidata+Frozen GPT-3 (175B) 53.1
KAT (Ensemble) gui2021kat Wikidata+Frozen GPT-3 (175B) 54.4
REVIVE (Single) Wikidata+Frozen GPT-3 (175B) 56.6
REVIVE (Ensemble) Wikidata+Frozen GPT-3 (175B) 58.0
references: As shown in Table 1, we can see that previous works (e.g., KRISP marino2021krisp , Visual Retriever-Reader luo2021weakly  and MAVEx wu2021multi ) achieve similar performances, about 38.4% to 39.4% accuracy. Until recently, PICa yang2021empirical  is the first one that exploits the pre-trained language model GPT-3 brown2020language  as knowledge base for knowledge-based VQA task and KAT gui2021kat  further introduces Wikidata vrandevcic2014wikidata  as an external knowledge resource, these two works obtain significant performances compared with previous ones.

S4.T3.caption: Table 2: Ablation study on using different region proposal number.
S4.T3.table:
# of region proposals Accuracy (%)
5 54.7
18 55.8
36 56.6
50 56.2
# of regional tags Accuracy (%)
8 56.2
24 56.4
30 56.6
50 56.3
references:
Effect of Region Proposal Number. 
We perform the ablation study to figure out the effect of using different region proposal numbers. The results are displayed in Table 3. It can be observed that when the region proposal number is 36, the model achieves optimal performance. We conjecture that when the number of region proposals is too large, there are some meaningless and noisy region proposals, while if the number of region proposals is too small, many essential object-centric regions are ignored, which both hurt the model‚Äôs performance.

Effect of Regional Tag Number.  In order to introduce more semantics into contexts, we propose to add region-aware descriptions (i.e., regional tags) behind given contexts. We report the results of using different regional tag number for text prompt XùëãX in Table 3. The results show that when the number of regional tags is 30, it achieves optimal performances. In fact, when the number of regional tags is too large, we‚Äôll retrieve relatively irrelevant object tags, sacrificing the model‚Äôs performance.

S4.T5.caption: Table 4: Ablation study on adopting bounding box coordinates.
S4.T5.table:
Positional coordinates Accuracy (%)
‚úó 55.8
‚úì 56.6
Method Accuracy (%)
Image-based 53.2
Sliding window-based 54.8
Region-based 56.6
references:
Effect of Region Proposal Number. 
We perform the ablation study to figure out the effect of using different region proposal numbers. The results are displayed in Table 3. It can be observed that when the region proposal number is 36, the model achieves optimal performance. We conjecture that when the number of region proposals is too large, there are some meaningless and noisy region proposals, while if the number of region proposals is too small, many essential object-centric regions are ignored, which both hurt the model‚Äôs performance.

Different Knowledge Retrieval Methods.  The way of utilizing visual representation for retrieving knowledge plays an important role in knowledge-based VQA. We show the results of using three kinds of knowledge retrieval methods, i.e., image-based, sliding window-based and region-based, in Table 5. Note that sliding window-based approach follows KAT gui2021kat . Specifically, we first resizes input images to 384 √ó\times 384 and then crop the images with a sliding window whose size is 256√ó256256256256\times 256 and stride size is 128. We can observe that the proposed region-based approach achieves best performance and surpasses sliding window-based method by 1.8% points, which can validate the effectiveness of exploiting region-based visual representation for retrieving knowledge.

Effect of Regional Tag Number.  In order to introduce more semantics into contexts, we propose to add region-aware descriptions (i.e., regional tags) behind given contexts. We report the results of using different regional tag number for text prompt XùëãX in Table 3. The results show that when the number of regional tags is 30, it achieves optimal performances. In fact, when the number of regional tags is too large, we‚Äôll retrieve relatively irrelevant object tags, sacrificing the model‚Äôs performance.

Effect of Positional Coordinates.  In addition to incorporating visual representation of object-centric region proposals into the model, we also adopt the position information (i.e., positional coordinates). The results of whether using positional coordinates are reported in Table 5. Introducing regional coordinates can improve the performance by 0.8% points.

S4.T6.caption: Table 6: Ablation study on different components of REVIVE. Note that ‚ÄúImp." and ‚ÄúR-Imp." mean implicit knowledge retrieved without and with the proposed regional descriptions, ‚ÄúExp." and ‚ÄúR-Exp." mean explicit knowledge retrieved without and with regional features, ‚ÄúVisual" represents object-centric region features, ‚ÄúContext" and ‚ÄúTag" mean introducing the contexts and regional descriptions (i.e. tags) into the final answering model respectively. ‚ÄúAcc." means accuracy.
S4.T6.table:
Imp. R-Imp. Exp. R-Exp. Visual Context Tag Acc. (%)
‚úì 51.2
‚úì ‚úì 52.4

‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì 54.0
‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì 55.4
‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì 55.9

references: Effect of Each Component. Finally, we showcase the results of using different components of REVIVE in Table 6. We can observe that the introduced components can consistently improve the model‚Äôs performance. Especially for knowledge retrieval, using the regional descriptions can improve the performance of implicit knowledge by 1.2%, while adopting the regional features can boost the performance of explicit knowledge retrieval by 1.1%.

A4.T8.caption: Table 7: Ablation study on using different implicit knowledge candidates. k1subscriptùëò1k_{1} represents the number of retrieved implicit knowledge candidates.
A4.T8.table:
k1subscriptùëò1k_{1} Accuracy (%)
1 55.8
3 56.3
5 56.6
8 56.4
k2subscriptùëò2k_{2} Accuracy (%)
10 55.6
20 55.9
30 56.2
40 56.6
50 56.3
references: Different Knowledge Retrieval Methods.  The way of utilizing visual representation for retrieving knowledge plays an important role in knowledge-based VQA. We show the results of using three kinds of knowledge retrieval methods, i.e., image-based, sliding window-based and region-based, in Table 5. Note that sliding window-based approach follows KAT gui2021kat . Specifically, we first resizes input images to 384 √ó\times 384 and then crop the images with a sliding window whose size is 256√ó256256256256\times 256 and stride size is 128. We can observe that the proposed region-based approach achieves best performance and surpasses sliding window-based method by 1.8% points, which can validate the effectiveness of exploiting region-based visual representation for retrieving knowledge.

Effect of Positional Coordinates.  In addition to incorporating visual representation of object-centric region proposals into the model, we also adopt the position information (i.e., positional coordinates). The results of whether using positional coordinates are reported in Table 5. Introducing regional coordinates can improve the performance by 0.8% points.

The effect of multiple implicit knowledge candidates.  To validate the influence of the number of retrieved implicit knowledge candidate on the model‚Äôs performance, we report the results in Table 8. When using only one implicit knowledge candidate, the model can achieve 55.8% accuracy, after taking 5 implicit knowledge candidates, the performance can be improved to 56.6% accuracy. However, when the retrieved candidate number is 8, we can see that the performance isn‚Äôt the best, we conjecture that it‚Äôs enough to include essential candidates when k1=subscriptùëò1absentk_{1}= 5. Due to certain incorrect answer predictions by GPT-3, larger k1subscriptùëò1k_{1} may introduce incorrect and unnecessary candidates, thus hurting the model‚Äôs performance by using too much noisy and misleading knowledge.

The effect of explicit knowledge number.  Since the number of retrieved explicit knowledge samples can have an effect on the model‚Äôs performance, we conduct the experiments and show the results in Table 8. We find the model can achieve optimal performance when k2=subscriptùëò2absentk_{2}= 40. It‚Äôs reasonable to see that a too large k2subscriptùëò2k_{2} (i.e., k2=subscriptùëò2absentk_{2}= 50) cannot let the model achieve optimal performance, since when k2subscriptùëò2k_{2} increases, there will exist certain retrieved explicit knowledge samples which have relatively low confidences, thus introducing unreliable knowledge and hurting the model‚Äôs performance.

A4.T9.caption: Table 9: Ablation study on using different object detectors. Note that Faster R-CNN (R50) and Faster R-CNN (R101) mean using ResNet-50 [9] and ResNet-101 [9] as backbones.
A4.T9.table:
Detector Accuracy (%)
Faster R-CNN (R50) 55.3
Faster R-CNN (R101) 55.6
GLIP 56.6
references: Effect of Each Component. Finally, we showcase the results of using different components of REVIVE in Table 6. We can observe that the introduced components can consistently improve the model‚Äôs performance. Especially for knowledge retrieval, using the regional descriptions can improve the performance of implicit knowledge by 1.2%, while adopting the regional features can boost the performance of explicit knowledge retrieval by 1.1%.

The effect of using different detectors.  To figure out the effect of choosing different object detectors on the final performances, we show the results of using Faster R-CNN [28] and GLIP [17] in Table 9. We can see that Faster R-CNN with ResNet-50 and ResNet-101 as the backbone can achieve 55.3% and 55.6% accuracy respectively, and using the GLIP as the object detector can achieve the optimal performance (i.e., 56.6%). These results demonstrate the accuracy of detecting object regions play an important role in the final performances.
